intro: Gentianodes aprica, commonly known as the spring gentian, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers, which typically bloom in early spring. The plant is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in woodland and meadow habitats. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. The flower structure includes two whorls of petals and is adapted for pollination by insects.
